article_node.title: US Government Might Use Funds From the CHIPS Act to Buy a Stake in Intel
article_node.summary: Intel is reportedly in discussions with the U.S. government about a potential equity stake purchase, which may utilize funds from the CHIPS and Science Act aimed at boosting domestic semiconductor manufacturing. This comes amid a tumultuous period for Intel, including CEO changes and significant layoffs, as the company seeks to stabilize its operations. Meanwhile, former President Trump has expressed skepticism about the CHIPS Act, advocating for tariffs as a more effective incentive for U.S. manufacturing.
